title: Whole cauliflower with pea purée

ingredients.content: 30 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
fresh chives, finely chopped, for garnishing

preparations.content: Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place 2 of the garlic cloves into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add paprika, tomato paste, thyme, oil, oregano, ½ teaspoon of the salt and 2 pinches of the pepper and mix <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl.
Remove any leaves from cauliflower and trim stalk so it sits flat. Place cauliflower into Varoma dish, then rub with reserved tomato paste mixture.
Place 1000 g water into mixing bowl, then place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Remove Varoma. Insert simmering basket and weigh peas into it. Add remaining garlic clove to simmering basket, then place Varoma back into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>5-7 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> or until peas and cauliflower are tender (see Tip). Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Discard cooking liquid.
Place cooked peas and garlic into mixing bowl. Add butter, cream, remaining salt, remaining pepper and remaining 30 g water and purée <b>25 sec/speed 7<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then purée <b>20 sec/speed 7<b> or until smooth. Transfer purée into a serving bowl.
Transfer cauliflower onto a serving plate. Sprinkle with reserved Parmesan cheese and chives. Serve immediately, cut into wedges with pea purée.

hintsAndTricks: Cooking time will vary according to the size of your cauliflower.
